metadata.creator: Sergio Contreras
metadata.description: This episode is a special report on the political events that have been taking place in Chile since 1988. The reporters show clips from a memorial service for Salvador Allende in ValparaÃ­so, Chile. The reporters then interview several Chilean politicians and figureheads in regards to the transition from a military dictatorship to an elected democracy. Clips of videos such as the new president's arrival and the dictator's departure from government; political ceremonies involving inaugurations of new politicians, and the people's reception of such events are shown. It then shows clips of a celebratory concert in Chile of the transition to democracy
